content.full_text: Fragment of Abraham Lincoln and Edward D. Baker to Unknown, 1
paragraphs: Fragment of Abraham Lincoln and Edward D. Baker to Unknown, 1
citations: Roy P. Basler, ed.,The Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln(New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 1953), 2:18, n1;Abraham Lincoln and Edward D. Baker to Thomas Ewing;Edward D. Baker and Abraham Lincoln to Thomas Ewing.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the text and signed his name.  Edward D. Baker signed this own
                  name.The actual date of this fragment is unknown.  Roy P. Basler, editor ofThe Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln,  placed the entire letter, of which this fragment is the last page, in 1849, resting
                  on the assumption that Lincoln wrote it during the competition for patronage that
                  followed the inauguration of Zachary Taylor as president.  Lincoln’s and Baker’s other
                  joint correspondence during this period offers ample evidence for Basler’s conjecture,
                  and the editors have retained Basler’s date.Roy P. Basler, ed.,The Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln(New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 1953), 2:18, n1;Abraham Lincoln and Edward D. Baker to Thomas Ewing;Edward D. Baker and Abraham Lincoln to Thomas Ewing.
